title: Halsey and Evan Peters turn heads as Sonny and Cher; more great celeb Halloween costumes
text:
CLOSE Here are 3 tips to help parents navigate Halloween shopping by avoiding potential culturally appropriation missteps when selecting costumes for kids. USA TODAY

It's not quite Halloween yet, but stars got busy celebrating the holiday in advance this weekend. From spooky to funny, topical to classic, these celebrities showed off buzz-worthy Halloween costumes.

Singer Halsey and Evan Peters appeared together on the red carpet for the first time Saturday at the "American Horror Story" 100th episode celebration in Hollywood. Dating rumors have swirled around the two since last month, when they were spotted holding hands at Six Flags. They haven't confirmed anything, but the Sonny and Cher couples costumes have fans wondering if the singer and actor are making things official.

USA TODAY has reached out to representatives for Halsey and Peters.

Evan Peters and Halsey at the "American Horror Story" 100th Episode Celebration on Oct. 26. (Photo: Rachel Luna, FilmMagic)

Demi Lovato

Lovato channeled the over-the-top stylings of Marie Antoinette in what she wrote was "round 1" of her Halloween costumes. In an Instagram post Friday, the 27-year-old singer showed off an elaborate ruffled dress with a huge blond wig and flawless makeup.

"I told y’all I don’t play on Halloween!! It’s my time to shine," Lovato captioned the photos, thanking her glam team for the wardrobe, hair and makeup assists.

Nick Viall

Former "Bachelor" star Viall's costume channeled the franchise's new star. Bachelor Nation fans will recognize Viall as Peter Weber, a Delta Air Lines pilot and the upcoming reality show lead. Viall, 39, wore a pilot's uniform, carried a rose and stuck a bandage onto his forehead, just like the real Weber, who had to get stitches earlier this month after he injured himself while filming "The Bachelor" in Costa Rica.

"Just a Pilot on a flight for love .. will probably crash into a windmill tonight" Viall captioned the photo.

Jessica Biel and Justin Timberlake

Biel channeled her husband's past as a boy band member, dressing like an NSYNC-era Justin Timberlake, crunchy frosted tips and all. Timberlake got in on the fun in a giant microphone costume.

"This is what happens when you admit on TV that you don’t know any NSYNC songs and you’re married to @justintimberlake," Biel captioned an Instagram post Saturday. "Well played, husband, well played."

Kate Beckinsale

Forget "Breakfast at Tiffany's." Beckinsale went for a snack at a convenience store. Dressed as an Audrey Hepburn lookalike, complete with a long, black dress, oversize hat and classic pearls, the model/actress, 46, posed in an Instagram photo with pal Jonathan Voluck (dressed in an Elton John-style glittering LA Dodgers costume), shopping in character for Funyuns.

What to watch: 5 TV shows and movies to binge for Halloween 2019

description: Stars are already busy celebrating Halloween. From spooky to funny, topical to classic, these celebrities showed off buzz-worthy costumes.
